moves.5... Nh6: !? This is very strange. More common, and my favorite is d5 giving back a pawn but helping to diffuse the attack.
moves.6. Nf3 f6: ? And this is baaaaad, weakening the light squares for no reason.
moves.7. O-O c6 8. e5 Be7 9. exf6 gxf6 10. Re1: In my opinion white has an advantage here despite the pawn deficit.
moves.10... Qc7: ?? This allows me to take his pawn, and fork his rook and pinned bishop.
moves.11... Rf8: Not what I would have chosen,
moves.12. Qd4: Better would have been Rxe7+ or Qe2.
moves.13... Rxf6: ?? And he fails to see it.
moves.15... Kd8: Again, his only move. I had to think for a while to find the sacrifice, but in the end I did.
moves.16. Qxf8+: And the queen sacrifice finishes him off.
moves.17. Re8#: Checkmate! Please drop a comment and rate.
